A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I was six years old when I saw the original Star Wars in the theater in 1977. It's the first movie I can remember seeing\, and I have been an incorrigible Star Wars fan since then.

The Last Jedi is one of my favorite Star Wars films yet. It's not perfect--it has moments that nearly broke my suspension of disbelief--but I don't understand the hate this film is getting. It is as beautiful as we expect a Star Wars film to be\, and while the story meanders a bit in places\, I felt everything came together in a compelling way. It leaves a number of loose ends\, as is appropriate for the middle act of a trilogy\, and it hints at a depth to the force that seems to have eluded both the Sith and the Jedi through their entire history. Add to that the best acting and dialogue I can remember in a Star Wars film\, and I can only describe the experience as phenomenal.

Go see the movie before you make a judgment on it. I think you will find as much to love in it as I did.
